CREAM PIE.instructions: In a saucepan, mix sugar and cornstarch (or flour). Slowly add milk and bring to a gentle boil, stirring until thickened. Remove from heat, add butter and vanilla. Temper egg yolks and stir back into mixture. Cook briefly to set. Pour into baked pie shell. Top with meringue or whipped cream.

CHILI VERDE.instructions: Brown pork with onions, spices. Combine all ingredients in a crock pot. Cook on low all day (or simmer on stove at least 1 hour), stirring occasionally.

SALMON BALL.instructions: Combine all ingredients thoroughly. Shape into a ball and chill. Roll in chopped pecans. Serve with crackers (e.g., Triscuit) and garnish with parsley.

ingredients.white_cake: Half-sheet or jelly-roll size (use mix or bakery cake)
ingredients.powdered_sugar: 1 cup (plus 1 cup used in whipped cream)

STRAWBERRY DREAM CAKE.instructions: Prepare cake as a thin layer. Whip cream with 1 cup powdered sugar, set aside. Beat cream cheese with 1 cup powdered sugar; fold in whipped cream and vanilla. Spread on cooled cake (top/sides). Prepare Danish Dessert, fold in sliced strawberries, and spoon over cream layer. Chill. Serves ~20.

4Bs OLD FASHIONED CREAM OF TOMATO SOUP.instructions: Combine chicken base, water, butter, onion, and sugar in a pot; simmer until onion is clear. Add tomatoes and baking soda, stir well. Add creams and gently heat. Serve hot.

ORANGE BOW KNOTS.instructions: Dissolve yeast in warm water. In a large bowl, combine lukewarm milk, shortening, sugar, salt, and 2 cups flour. Stir in eggs, yeast, orange juice, and peel. Add more flour for a soft dough. Let rest 10 min, then knead 8-10 min. Let rise ~2 hours, punch down, rest 10 min. Shape into bow knots, let rise ~45 min. Bake at 350°F until lightly browned.

ingredients.water: enough to fill half the roaster

BEEF FRENCH DIP.instructions: Rub roast with kitchen bouquet, garlic, and seasonings. Place in deep roaster with water half full, add ketchup, mustard, onions, carrots, celery. Cover and cook at 200°F for ~20 hours. Slice and use juices for dipping.

PRIME RIB.instructions: Roast at 300°F for ~20 minutes per pound. Let stand 1 hour (in the turned-off oven) before carving.

POLLO PASTORELLA.instructions: Sauté mushrooms and onions in 1/4 cup butter; set aside. In a large pan, melt 4 tbsp butter, whisk in 4 tbsp flour. Gradually add chicken broth, wine, and lemon juice. Stir until thickened. Add mushrooms, onions, and capers. Just before serving, stir in peas. Serve over broiled chicken breasts. Thin sauce with heated broth if needed.

FOOL PROOF PIE CRUST.instructions: Stir flour, sugar, and salt in a bowl. Cut in shortening until crumbly. In a separate bowl, beat egg, water, and vinegar. Add to flour mixture until moistened. Divide dough into 4 portions, flatten, wrap, and chill 30+ minutes. Roll each between wax paper to fit 9-10 inch pie pans.

RICE PILAF.instructions: Melt butter, add rice, brown slightly (do not burn butter). Add vermicelli, almonds, rosemary, salt, and pepper. Pour simmering broth over rice mixture, cover, reduce heat, and simmer ~20 minutes. Turn off heat and fluff. Can hold for 2 hours without reheating.

CLAM CHOWDER.large_quantity_note: Uses a 21.5 oz flour mix and 4 qts half-and-half.

ingredients.flour_mix: 21 1/2 oz (with 2 tbsp salt, 2 tsp pepper mixed in)

CLAM CHOWDER.instructions: Simmer potatoes, celery, and onion in water until tender; do not drain. In top of double boiler, combine clams, juice, cooked veggies, butter, and ~1.5 qts water/broth. Heat to melt butter. Stir in flour mix with ~2 qts half-and-half. Then add remaining 2 qts half-and-half. Heat 25-30 min, stirring frequently, until thickened.

CHOCOLATE CREAM PIE.instructions: Combine sugar and cornstarch. Stir in milk and chocolate. Cook over medium heat, stirring, until bubbling. Cook 2 minutes more. Temper egg yolks and return to hot filling. Bring to boil, cook 2 more minutes. Remove from heat, stir in butter and vanilla. Pour into baked crust.

ingredients.butter_or_margarine: enough to spread on bread + grease dish

CHEESE SOUFFLE.instructions: Butter a 9x13 dish. Butter bread, cut into cubes. Layer half bread cubes, half cheeses, half sausage. Repeat. Whisk eggs, half-and-half, and seasonings. Pour over layers. Cover and refrigerate overnight. Bake at 325°F ~1 hour, until set and lightly browned.

POTATOES AUGRATIN.instructions: Layer potatoes, salt/pepper, onion, cheese in a baking dish, repeating layers with cheese on top. Pour cream over. Cover and bake at 350°F ~45 min. Uncover and bake 15-20 min longer or until potatoes are tender.

PEANUT BRITTLE.instructions: Cook water, sugar, syrup to 250°F. Add peanuts + salt. Continue cooking to 295°F. Remove from heat, add butter, vanilla, baking soda. Stir and pour onto greased cookie sheets.

2 DOZEN ENCHILADAS.note: Recipe actually makes ~4 dozen tortillas but final yield is 2 dozen filled enchiladas if desired.

ingredients.enchilada_sauce: 1 large can (Las Palmas or Rosarita, mild)

2 DOZEN ENCHILADAS.instructions: Heat oil in pan. Quickly dip tortillas in hot oil. Dip in warmed enchilada sauce/soup mixture. Fill each tortilla with cheese, olives, onion. Roll and place in baking pan. Top with remaining cheese. Bake at 350°F ~15-20 min until bubbly. Serve with sour cream.

ingredients.grated_cheddar_cheese: 3 cups total (2 cups go in sauce, 1 cup topping)

O’BRIEN POTATOES.instructions: Make a white sauce with butter, flour, milk. Season to taste. Stir in 2 cups cheese, pimento, green pepper, onion. Layer half the potatoes in a 9x13 pan, season, top with half the sauce and a bit of cheese. Repeat. Bake at 350°F ~45 min.

PAELLA SALAD.instructions: Heat oil, sauté onion. Add bouillon and spices, bring to boil. Stir in rice, cover, cook on low ~30 min or until liquid is absorbed. Chill. Combine chilled rice with shrimp, chicken, peppers, capers, pimento, celery, and enough Italian dressing to moisten. Garnish with tomatoes and olives.

OLD FASHIONED CARROT CAKE.instructions: Combine dry ingredients. Add oil, mix well. Add eggs and carrots, mix again. Bake at 350°F for 30-40 min. Cool before frosting.

GREEN CHILI SALSA.instructions: Mix everything in a large bowl. Chill. Serve cold.

ROQUEFORT DRESSING.instructions: Combine all ingredients. Thin with buttermilk if too thick. Chill before serving.

CHEESE CHICKEN BROCCOLI CASSEROLE.instructions: Steam chicken; reserve broth. Make a white sauce with broth, melt cheese into it. Cook noodles, drain. Layer noodles, broccoli, chicken, sauce; repeat. Top with more cheese and bread crumbs. Bake at 350°F for 30-40 min.

ingredients.berries: 7 oz (type unspecified, possibly cranberries or mixed berries)

POLLO ORANGE SAUCE (SERVES 20).instructions: Heat all (except cornstarch) to just under boiling. Before serving, whisk in cornstarch slurry to thicken. Ladle over broiled chicken breasts garnished with an orange slice.

TACO SOUP.instructions: Brown meat and onion, season with garlic salt. Add water, beans, tomatoes, sauce, and taco seasoning. Simmer ~15 min. Adjust seasoning with cumin/chili powder if desired. Serve with cheese, avocado, sour cream, fritos.

YEAST ROLLS.instructions: Dissolve yeast in cooled scalded milk with sugar. Let stand 5 min. Add eggs, shortening, salt, and flour. Knead 10 min. Let rise 1 hr, punch down, shape into rolls, let rise again 1 hr. Bake at 425°F until golden.

PUMPKIN CHOCOLATE CHIP COOKIES.instructions: Cream shortening and sugar. Add egg, pumpkin, then dry ingredients. Stir in chocolate chips. Drop spoonfuls on cookie sheet. Bake at 350°F ~10-12 min until lightly browned.
